AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed.synopsis: AD dialog after Kerri spawns next to the destroyed portrait, says a one liner and teleports to oskar, leaving players in the atelier, having to hurry to save oskar.
AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed.how_to_trigger: Attacking the portrait having equipeped Location: CTY_Main_A -258; 34; -43

YellingServant.synopsis: One liner with servant supervisor, will say one thing or another depending on whether player convinced him to not fire him.

CleaningServant.synopsis: One liner dialog with a cleaning servant that was getting fired. If player stopped it and saved him, he will reveal the location of the masterpiece painting and reveal the hidden wall. If fired, he leaves the house, angry
CleaningServant.how_to_trigger: Talk to servant in CTY_Main_A -258; 29; -49 after interrupting his firing and convincing supervisor not to go through with it.

AD_KerriComment_Turn1.synopsis: First Combat AD for Kerri's spirit during combat with the player. She wants to claim Oskar's spirit and take him back to the ethereal plane as punishment for bringing her back

AD_StaffBeratingServant.synopsis: Lady Jannath's Chamberlain is in the process of firing a junior servant, Bailey. The servant knows to keep quiet. If the player does not interrupt the firing, then servant Bailey leaves for good.

Kerri.synopsis: Dialog with the ghost of Kerri Evenfield, now freed from Oskar's body and hells-bent on taking him to the afterlife with her. She's incandescent with angry, but if the player successfully calms her anger, they can hear her explanation of her recent suicide, and get her to leave peacefully. Otherwise, they end up in combat.
Kerri.how_to_trigger: Enter the trigger S_LOW_FinalConfrontationTrigger in CTY_Main_A after having destroyed kerri's portrait in the atelier with the candle of revocation.Location:CTY_Main_A  -250; 30; -46

AD_JannathReactToBedInteraction.synopsis: AD that gets triggered when interacting with the bed in Oskar's room while he is still possessed.

AD_AngryNobleVictory_002.synopsis: One of the two nobles duelling over the sale of a fraudulent painting, while at a party in Lady Jannath's house. In this instance, the victim of the fraud has won.

AD_AtelierPortrait_001.how_to_trigger: oe LOW_OskarsBeloved_BringOskarHomego to CTY_Main_A -268; 39; -40Interact with portrait in that position.

If the player met him previously and refused/failed to help him, he's quite angry at them, but has nonetheless managed to create a more comfortable situation for himself. If the player never met him, he's simply a counterfeiter trying to sell them a fake painting he needs to offload.

He will give some information to players pointing to his previous actions before the possession, variously Mystic Carrion, the atelier, and the cursed paint. His words are hoarse and laboured - the ghost possessing him has been screaming and shouting. If Jannath is present she will interject at the beginning

AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed_1.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed_1.text: What is it, Oskar? I thought you wanted to see me again...
AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed_1.context: NodeContext: Threatening him, toying with him - about to attack

AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed_0.speaker: Lady Jannath
AD_ReactionPortraitDestroyed_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified, trying to defend her husband

YellingServant_0.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
YellingServant_0.text: This is a staff area, saer. Anything a guest could want can be found downstairs.

YellingServant_1.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
YellingServant_1.text: Saer, I must remind you that this is a staff-only area. I'm sure you don't wish to impede the staff in their work.

YellingServant_2.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
YellingServant_2.text: You've made your point, saer. And now I think you'll find that you'll be more comfortable downstairs in the guest area.

YellingServant_3.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
YellingServant_3.text: One hates to speak with asperity to a guest, saer, but you really belong downstairs.

CleaningServant_1.speaker: Servant Bailey
CleaningServant_1.text: Thanks for stepping in. One day I'll wipe that smile off his smug face. But not today - I need this job.
CleaningServant_1.context: NodeContext: Relieved, still seething at the reprimand he just got

CleaningServant_4.speaker: Servant Bailey
CleaningServant_4.text: You're one of the collectors from downstairs, I suppose? As you're up here, you might be interested in the atelier.

CleaningServant_0.speaker: Servant Bailey
CleaningServant_0.text: Lady Jannath keeps some of her finest works up there. Ready for a private viewing, if you catch my meaning. But you never heard it from me.

CleaningServant_2.speaker: Servant Bailey
CleaningServant_2.text: We'd better not talk further. That arsehole will take any excuse to fire me.

CleaningServant_3.speaker: Servant Bailey
CleaningServant_3.text: I can't help you. Ask someone who still works here.
CleaningServant_3.context: NodeContext: Pissed off, just got fired

CleaningServant_5.speaker: Servant Bailey
CleaningServant_5.context: NodeContext: Pissed off, just got fired

AD_KerriComment_Turn1_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
AD_KerriComment_Turn1_0.text: 'Til death do us part - isn't that what you promised, Oskar?
AD_KerriComment_Turn1_0.context: NodeContext: Mocking, mid-combat line. 'Til death do us part' a riff on marriage vow

AD_StaffBeratingServant_2.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_StaffBeratingServant_2.text: Pack your things! You're no longer a member of this staff.
AD_StaffBeratingServant_2.context: NodeContext: Berating, but not raising his voice

AD_StaffBeratingServant_0.speaker: Servant Bailey
AD_StaffBeratingServant_0.text: I'm sorry, Mr Mercer. It was an accident!

AD_StaffBeratingServant_3.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_StaffBeratingServant_3.text: Lady Jannath tolerates many things, but your clumsiness... it is unacceptable.
AD_StaffBeratingServant_3.context: NodeContext: Scolding, like this is the worst possible thing in the world. Not raising his voice.

AD_StaffBeratingServant_1.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_StaffBeratingServant_1.text: If you wish to treat this like an alehouse, then go and work in one!
AD_StaffBeratingServant_1.context: NodeContext: Berating, but not raising his voice

Kerri_50.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_50.text: Who are you? Get out. GET OUT!
Kerri_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kerri has cornered a very frightened-looking Oskar. Oskar holds up his hands in a placatory/calming gesture. Kerri turns to her left 80 degrees and sees the player, face twisted with fury.NodeContext: Furious, threatening

Kerri_26.speaker: Oskar Fevras
Kerri_26.text: Please... Kerri, my darling, listen to me -
Kerri_26.context: NodeContext: Frightened, hoping his charm will calm her down

Kerri_69.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_69.text: You brought me here. YOU DID THIS.

Kerri_22.speaker: Lady Jannath
Kerri_22.text: Do something - she's going to kill him!

Kerri_51.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_51.text: DO NOT INTERFERE. He's coming home with me.
Kerri_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kerri turns to her left 90 degrees from Oskar, and squares up to the player on DO NOT INTERFERE. She blocks their access to Oskar.NodeContext: Haunting, threatening

Kerri_48.speaker: Player
Kerri_48.text: Calm yourself, shade. We can resolve this peacefully.

Kerri_71.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_71.text: Another who wants to control me.

Kerri_54.speaker: Player
Kerri_54.text: To the realms of the dead? You'll kill him!

Kerri_85.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_85.text: He called me here. Trapped me. Pathetic little childish boy.

Kerri_46.speaker: Oskar Fevras
Kerri_46.text: I only wished to explain myself. To make you see how -
Kerri_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises a hand, as though uncertain about drawing attention to himselfNodeContext: trying to say "how sorry I was", but gets cut off

Kerri_30.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_30.text: NO! Enough of your whining. ENOUGH.
Kerri_30.context: NodeContext: Furious, taking control of the situation

Kerri_35.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_35.text: Selfish, arrogant bastard of an artist. I wanted to be left in peace.
Kerri_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oskar cowers as Kerri turns to her right 80 degrees towards him. The player edges closer.NodeContext: Fury starting to break, a hint of sadness beneath it all

Kerri_52.speaker: Player
Kerri_52.text: Please. Tell us what happened to you.

Kerri_60.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_60.text: And how does that help me? Or is it just to help him?

Kerri_76.speaker: Player
Kerri_76.text: You don't seem all that peaceful to me.

Kerri_33.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_33.text: Neither would you, if you'd been dragged here by this self-important arsehole.

Kerri_2.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_2.text: Why does everything always have to revolve around Oskar Fevras?

Kerri_75.speaker: Oskar Fevras
Kerri_75.text: Oh, my sweet Kerri. What did I do to you?
Kerri_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stifling a sobNodeContext: Stifling a sob

Kerri_58.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_58.text: Save your tears for the Ethereal Plane...
Kerri_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kerri takes a big step towards Oskar, who shields his face, expecting an attack.NodeContext: Menacing, about to kill him

Kerri_15.speaker: Player
Kerri_15.text: Touch him, and you'll face all of nature's fury. You'll face me.

Kerri_12.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_12.text: What are you saying? You're trying to confuse me.

Kerri_57.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_57.text: It's so hard to think. I don't remember.
Kerri_57.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with herself, still angry

Kerri_63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
Kerri_63.text: Kerri, my sweet meat. I just need to know that what you did... that it wasn't my fault -

Kerri_49.speaker: Lady Jannath
Kerri_49.context: NodeContext: Low, strict - trying not to attrack Kerri's attention

Kerri_89.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_89.text: Why am I here? I shouldn't be here, I shouldn't be.
Kerri_89.context: NodeContext: Angry, distressed. Unclear whether she's about to lash out, or break down in tears. Almost accusing the player.

Kerri_53.speaker: Narrator
Kerri_53.text: *The spirit's aura flickers, changes. She is confused, lost - dragged here unwillingly by a man who refused to let her leave.*

Kerri_42.speaker: Player
Kerri_42.text: You had a message for us, remember? You were going to tell us why you died by your own hand.

Kerri_17.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_17.text: You're a worthless human and a worse artist, Oskar Fevras. You never should have brought me here.

Kerri_40.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_40.text: Fine. If Oskar wants the truth, he can have it: we were a fling, nothing more.

Kerri_13.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_13.text: My decision had nothing to do with him. I did this because I was so fucking sad. All the time.

Kerri_67.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_67.text: Oskar finds it easier to imagine a world where women kill themselves over him than one where they have their own bloody problems.
Kerri_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing a finger at Oskar

Kerri_64.speaker: Oskar Fevras
Kerri_64.text: I'm sorry, Kerri. I had no idea. But I - I was truly not to blame?
Kerri_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Almost sagging with reliefNodeContext: Contrite, humbled

Kerri_68.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_68.text: No, you weren't, so you and your poxy paintings stay away from me. We're done, Oskar. Over. Now let me rest in bloody peace.
Kerri_68.context: NodeContext: Pissed off but back in control of herself. A stern warning at the end.

Kerri_72.speaker: Player
Kerri_72.text: You came to deliver a message. To tell us what led to your fate.

Kerri_23.speaker: Player
Kerri_23.text: Tell Oskar what he wants to hear. OUT WITH IT.

Kerri_62.speaker: Player
Kerri_62.text: You owe Oskar an explanation. And you're going to give it to him...

Kerri_59.speaker: Player
Kerri_59.text: Do not be shackled by your story, spirit. Share it - let it set you free.

Kerri_65.speaker: Player
Kerri_65.text: Oskar does not matter - you do. Say what you need to say to him - no matter how difficult it is.

Kerri_44.speaker: Player
Kerri_44.text: No more harm will come to you by sharing your story. But it could help Oskar.

Kerri_73.speaker: Player
Kerri_73.text: Calm, spirit. Tell us of your fate, then your soul shall be freed - I swear it.

Kerri_4.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_4.text: Why should I trust you? Why would I ever trust him?
Kerri_4.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

Kerri_45.speaker: Player
Kerri_45.text: You owe Oskar nothing. He only brought you here to soothe his conscience.

Kerri_8.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_8.text: If you believe that, then why are you helping him?

Kerri_86.speaker: Player
Kerri_86.text: Your bonds are broken. Go, if that is your wish.

Kerri_61.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_61.text: And let Oskar walk away? No, I won't do it.

Kerri_7.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_7.text: And who are you, some fawning obsessive like that rich cow 'Lady Jannath'? I bet Oskar loves that.
Kerri_7.context: NodeContext: 'Lady Jannath' in a mocking way

Kerri_28.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_28.text: Die with him if you love him so much.

Kerri_32.speaker: Player
Kerri_32.text: You're on the Material Plane - my hunting ground. Back off, or face me.

Kerri_78.speaker: Player
Kerri_78.text: I'll burn you, and potentially everyone else here, to ash if you don't stop this.

Kerri_37.speaker: Player
Kerri_37.text: You will burn like everything else on this plane, spirit, if you harm this man.

Kerri_84.speaker: Player
Kerri_84.text: Stop this, or I will educate you on the true meaning of torment and suffering.

Kerri_74.speaker: Player
Kerri_74.text: I don't care if you're a spirit. Touch him, and I'll break you.

Kerri_3.speaker: Player
Kerri_3.text: The Kerri Oskar spoke of was kind and gentle. This isn't the real you.

Kerri_31.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_31.text: Why should I be the better person? He's the one tormenting me!

Kerri_41.speaker: Player
Kerri_41.text: Your spirit is twisted by hate and fear, but this isn't you. You're kind and gentle - I can sense it.

Kerri_38.speaker: Player
Kerri_38.text: Ask yourself  - will killing this man make you happy? Give you purpose? Or are you better than this?

Kerri_9.speaker: Player
Kerri_9.text: He won't disturb you again. I'll make sure of it.

Kerri_10.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_10.text: And you think he'll listen to you? He doesn't listen to anyone.

Kerri_1.speaker: Player
Kerri_1.text: Mystic Carrion was the one behind this. It wasn't Oskar's fault.

Kerri_11.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_11.text: I'm here because Oskar wanted me here. To make him feel better.

Kerri_83.speaker: Player
Kerri_83.text: I rather like interfering. It's kind of my thing.

Kerri_25.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
Kerri_25.text: Then you're as bad as him.

Kerri_16.speaker: Player
Kerri_16.text: Listen - you're lost and in pain. This plane is not meant for spirits.

Kerri_29.speaker: Player
Kerri_29.text: I don't take orders from most people - especially not a ghost. Stand down.

Kerri_82.speaker: Player
Kerri_82.text: Hurt this man, and you will face the consequences, spirit.

Kerri_20.speaker: Player
Kerri_20.text: This man is under my protection - I cannot let you hurt him.

AD_JannathReactToBedInteraction_1.speaker: Lady Jannath
AD_JannathReactToBedInteraction_1.text: Be careful - that bed already crushed one maidservant!

AD_AngryNobleVictory_002_0.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AD_AngryNobleVictory_002_0.text: You should have paid me back, Delwaer. It would have been cheaper.
AD_AngryNobleVictory_002_0.context: NodeContext: ''Washing his hands of the business.

Jannath_17.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_17.text: If you don't wish to help, leave.

Jannath_235.speaker: Player
Jannath_235.text: I'll look into it. Any idea where I should start?

Jannath_225.speaker: Player
Jannath_225.text: I'm not one of your servants. You can't order me around.

Jannath_249.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_249.text: I can assure you, you wouldn't get a job on my staff. Now if you've nothing to contribute - leave.
Jannath_249.context: NodeContext: Scornful, unimpressed you won't help Oskar

Jannath_18.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_18.text: Now, not that I'm ungrateful for your help, but -
Jannath_18.context: NodeContext: Relieved, trying to hurry you out of the house until she realises -

Jannath_106.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_106.text: Wait - your face is familiar to me. Yes, I've seen it before, in Oskar's sketches. You're the one who saved him from the Zhentarim.
Jannath_106.context: NodeContext: Recognising you, can't wuite beleive it's true

Jannath_45.speaker: Player
Jannath_45.text: What in the hells is going on here?

Jannath_9.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_9.text: I imagine this must be quite a shock. Hardly the Oskar you remember.

Jannath_245.speaker: Player
Jannath_245.text: I came to congratulate you on your wedding, but, erm...

Jannath_171.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_171.text: Yes, it's all gone rather tits up, hasn't it? To think that happiness was just a few days ago...

Jannath_172.speaker: Player
Jannath_172.text: And you must be his patron?

Jannath_169.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_169.text: I used to be. Now I'm his wife - we married not a tenday ago. Things have changed rather a lot since then...

Jannath_68.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_68.text: Had I known this would happen, I... oh, who am I kidding? I'd still have married him.

Jannath_204.speaker: Player
Jannath_204.text: He's a charming git, I'll give him that.

Jannath_63.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_63.text: That's Oskar. I've known many artists, and none have half his talent, or his charisma. He had our guests eating from the palm of his hands.
Jannath_63.context: NodeContext: A sad smile - warmed by the memory of him, but sad at what he's become

Jannath_66.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_66.text: Yes, I suppose I love him entirely.

Jannath_233.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_233.text: This isn't the real him - you know it as well as I.

Jannath_33.speaker: Player
Jannath_33.text: I hope he drew my most heroic side.

Jannath_34.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_34.text: Both sides of you look the same to me. But he worked hard to capture your likeness. Sketched you over and over until he was satisfied.

Jannath_59.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_59.text: You made quite an impression. His 'valiant protector'. A shame you didn't get here sooner. You might have saved him again.
Jannath_59.context: NodeContext: 'Valiant protector' said with a hint of a smile, recalling Oskar's passionate stories of the player. Then a hint of black humour at the thought you could have saved him (didn't really expect you to)

Jannath_16.speaker: Player
Jannath_16.text: What exactly is wrong with him?

Jannath_149.speaker: Player
Jannath_149.text: Why would I do that? I'm not his bloody wet nurse.

Jannath_22.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_22.text: Don't take that tone with me. I know he's not your responsibility. He's mine. And I'm failing him.
Jannath_22.context: NodeContext: First half up to 'responsibility' is sharp - she's a noble, not one who tolerates being disrespected. Second half with a sigh - she's frustrated, angry at herself

Jannath_195.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_195.text: You should have seen him on our wedding day. So vibrant. So alive. He couldn't have been happier.
Jannath_195.context: NodeContext: Hiding her heartbreak, trying to sound matter of fact

Jannath_209.speaker: Player
Jannath_209.text: You're his wife. Isn't that your responsibility now?

Jannath_248.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_248.text: You think I haven't tended to him? Mopped his brow? Cleaned his messes? But whatever this is - it is beyond my ability to cure.

Jannath_111.speaker: Player
Jannath_111.text: I'm not here to save anyone. I just want the gold Oskar owes me.

Jannath_87.speaker: Player
Jannath_87.text: 'Impoverished purchaser', more like. I'm here to collect the gold he owes me.

Jannath_48.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_48.text: As you can see, Oskar is in no condition to pay anyone anything.

Jannath_148.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_148.text: Not long after the wedding, he lost his appetite, fell into dark moods. He started to avoid my company entirely.
Jannath_148.context: NodeContext: Trying not to sound hurt/take this personally

Jannath_184.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_184.text: Artistic temperament, I thought. But it worsened. He became violent. Called me some rather imaginative names.
Jannath_184.context: NodeContext: 'imaginative names' implying vile swear words

Jannath_28.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_28.text: I hesitate to say it... but I think you're right. Something supernatural has taken hold of him. Oskar has been possessed.

Jannath_93.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_93.text: I hesitate to say it... Something unnatural has taken hold of him. Oskar has been possessed.
Jannath_93.context: NodeContext: 'unnatural' implying supernatural. As a practical woman, she can hardly believe she's saying this

Jannath_176.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_176.text: The last time I left this room, the walls started bleeding, and a portrait of my mother tried to bite me.

Jannath_64.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_64.text: Flying furniture and screaming portraits I could deal with, but to see my husband reduced to such a state...

Jannath_14.speaker: Player
Jannath_14.text: I had no idea he'd married. Then I take it you were his patron?

Jannath_46.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_46.text: I can't come within arm's reach without him trying to strangle me. And he calls me such vile things. It hates everyone, but it loathes me.

Jannath_159.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_159.text: It's not him. I know he would never hurt me. And I promised I would let no harm come to him...
Jannath_159.context: NodeContext: almost to self, not sure if she believes it any more

Jannath_109.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_109.text: As you can see, I've already failed. It's obvious he needs more help than I can give.
Jannath_109.context: NodeContext: Disappointed in herself, tried to protect him but

Jannath_61.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_61.text: Please - you saved him once. You must find a way to cure him.

Jannath_237.speaker: Player
Jannath_237.text: While I've been... aided by powerful forces, that doesn't mean I can help Oskar. He needs an expert.

Jannath_132.speaker: Player
Jannath_132.text: Possessions cannot be fixed with a simple 'cure'. He needs an expert in the supernatural.

Jannath_122.speaker: Player
Jannath_122.text: Trust me. He's not worth the trouble.

Jannath_214.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_214.text: He's my husband. He's worth everything.

Jannath_147.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_147.text: I'm surprised you're so callous. This is hardly the picture Oskar painted of you.
Jannath_147.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - she'd heard you were Oskar's guardian angel

Jannath_135.speaker: Player
Jannath_135.text: He's a flatterer and a liar. He loved another when he married you.

Jannath_136.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_136.text: Hardly a revelation. Who doesn't have old flames to douse before they settle down? The matter was resolved, and our marriage began an honest one.

Jannath_103.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_103.text: If that's your only objection, then disregard it, and help him. He needs you.

Jannath_8.speaker: Player
Jannath_8.text: While I've been... aided by powerful forces, that doesn't mean I can help Oskar. He needs an expert.

Jannath_104.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_104.text: I can't tell anyone about this. It was hard enough to keep it from the servants.

Jannath_70.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_70.text: The city is rife with paranoia. If word got out about his condition... well, the Steel Watch are hardly known for showing mercy.

Jannath_185.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_185.text: I need someone to look into this quietly. It's the only chance he has.

Jannath_158.speaker: Player
Jannath_158.text: Possessions cannot be fixed with a simple 'cure'. He needs an expert in the supernatural.

Jannath_194.speaker: Player
Jannath_194.text: He needs a doctor, not an adventurer.

Jannath_115.speaker: Player
Jannath_115.text: He's too dangerous. A merciful death is the best I can offer.

Jannath_91.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_91.text: I hardly think we need to consider something that drastic.
Jannath_91.context: NodeContext: Firm on the first statement - she won't entertain the idea

Jannath_243.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_243.text: I will tend to him as I have been. Perhaps he will regain his sense of his own accord, once this spirit tires of tormenting us.

Jannath_143.speaker: Player
Jannath_143.text: Fine, I'll do it. But I need his debt settled, and more.

Jannath_74.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jannath raises an eyebrowNodeContext: Almost amused by you, just an observation

Jannath_133.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_133.text: Gold is no object, when it comes to my husband's life. But first, you must cure him.
Jannath_133.context: NodeContext: Stifling her annoyance that you're bringing up money at a time like this

Jannath_221.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_221.text: Oskar's behaviour began to change shortly after the wedding. He became withdrawn, working obsessively up in his atelier.

Jannath_207.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_207.text: I tried to take him some food, but I couldn't cross the threshold. It was as though the house itself didn't want me up there.

Jannath_11.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_11.text: Whatever this thing is, it doesn't want anyone going up there. I swear it's in the walls, watching.

Jannath_75.speaker: Player
Jannath_75.text: This time, Oskar's on his own.

Jannath_4.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_4.text: You might be ready to abandon Oskar, but I'm not.

Jannath_150.speaker: Player
Jannath_150.text: I suppose I'd best live up to my reputation, then. Where should I start?

Jannath_145.speaker: Player
Jannath_145.text: Face of an angel, soul of a cad, I'm afraid.

Jannath_54.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_54.text: I see. Then I think you should go.

Jannath_179.speaker: Player
Jannath_179.text: What married couple hasn't wanted to kill each other at some point?

Jannath_231.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_231.text: This is no time for trite witticisms - this is serious.

Jannath_192.speaker: Player
Jannath_192.text: It doesn't seem personal - he tried to kill me too.

Jannath_239.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_239.text: It's true, he lashes out at everyone. I had to send my staff away for their safety.
Jannath_239.context: NodeContext: Not being patronising, simply stating the truth

Jannath_156.speaker: Player
Jannath_156.text: You're sure he hasn't been, you know, sniffing his paints...?

Jannath_181.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_181.text: He almost broke my arm this morning when I tried to feed him soup.
Jannath_181.context: NodeContext: Giving an example of something horrifically violent Oskar has done

Jannath_24.speaker: Player
Jannath_24.text: I'm not generally fond of my face being known.

Jannath_86.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_86.text: He made a point to keep it in his private collection. Was quite adamant about it, in fact.

Jannath_188.speaker: Player
Jannath_188.text: It's no easy task facing up against a loved one. Well done.

Jannath_236.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_236.text: I've had plenty of practice, unfortunately.

Jannath_183.speaker: Player
Jannath_183.text: I know the signs of the supernatural when I see them. Tell me everything about Oskar's condition.

Jannath_78.speaker: Player
Jannath_78.text: I know supernatural influence when I see it. Tell me everything about Oskar's condition.

Jannath_246.speaker: Player
Jannath_246.text: You're remarkably calm, given your husband just tried to kill us.

Jannath_199.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_199.text: I'm getting rather used to it, unfortunately.

Jannath_208.speaker: Player
Jannath_208.text: I did. And I've come to collect the reward he promised.

Jannath_76.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_76.text: Oskar's saviour once more. I can't tell you how grateful I am to you.

Jannath_182.speaker: Player
Jannath_182.text: You're most welcome. Anything to support the arts.

Jannath_201.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_201.text: Yes, rather more exciting than a fund-raising banquet, wasn't it?
Jannath_201.context: NodeContext: Wry smile, allowing herself to relax slightly

Jannath_41.speaker: Player
Jannath_41.text: You're sure you want to stay with Oskar, after all this?

Jannath_51.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_51.text: I'm afraid when one falls in love with an artist, such drama comes with the territory.

Jannath_196.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_196.text: Needless to say, Oskar won't be having anything more to do with the supernatural. One possession is quite enough for any marriage.

Jannath_19.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_19.text: You must take up his offer - go to his atelier, sit for him. Then perhaps you will understand what I see in him, flawed as he is.

Jannath_131.speaker: Player
Jannath_131.text: You can show me. With gold. Lots of gold.

Jannath_166.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_166.text: I wouldn't dream of rewarding such bravery with gold. Besides, this is Oskar's debt to settle.

Jannath_71.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_71.text: The painting he offers is worth far more - one day, it may be priceless. He will go on to great things, thanks to you.

Jannath_73.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_73.text: Please - go to his atelier. Sit for him. You won't be disappointed.

Jannath_96.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_96.text: A new face. How wonderful. Always good to see fresh interest in the arts.

Jannath_97.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_97.text: Please - enjoy the day. Just don't touch anything.

Jannath_29.speaker: Player
Jannath_29.text: May I ask who you are?

Jannath_100.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_100.text: I am Lady Fireliia Jannath, mistress of the house and patron of the arts.

Jannath_40.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_40.text: I'm glad to welcome art lovers of all kinds beneath my roof, so please - feel free to enjoy my galleries.

Jannath_160.speaker: Player
Jannath_160.text: Could I buy something from your private collection?

Jannath_65.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_65.text: Ah, you're a fellow collector. I see no harm in that - I've a few pieces gathering dust.

Jannath_112.speaker: Player
Jannath_112.text: How much, off the top of your head, would you say some of your paintings are worth?

Jannath_244.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_244.text: Many were painted by someone I held dear to my heart. And, as such, they are like him - priceless. I have some other pieces I'd be willing to part with, if you'd like to take a look?
Jannath_244.context: NodeContext: a small smile as she thinks of oskar

Jannath_114.speaker: Player
Jannath_114.text: I think I met your fiancé, Oskar.

Jannath_56.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_56.text: You did? Well, finish the thought. Where is he? What happened to him?
Jannath_56.context: NodeContext: Brisk, used to getting what she asks for

Jannath_232.speaker: Player
Jannath_232.text: Oh, I really haven't the foggiest. I lost him some time ago.

Jannath_187.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_187.text: Then we are both adrift on the same tide. Perhaps one day we will learn what became of him.

Jannath_170.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_170.text: Still, there's no balm for a wounded soul like a moment reflecting on a good painting. Please - enjoy your visit.

Jannath_138.speaker: Player
Jannath_138.text: He was enslaved by the Zhentarim. I saw him die.

Jannath_164.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_164.text: Why would those thugs take my poor, sweet Oskar? Did they want money? I never received a ransom note...

Jannath_222.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_222.text: I knew he didn't leave willingly. Oh, my gentle painter... snuffed out like a candle.
Jannath_222.context: NodeContext: Deeply upset, maintaining a stiff upper lip

Jannath_21.speaker: Player
Jannath_21.text: He died a horrible death, screaming in agony.

Jannath_203.speaker: Player
Jannath_203.text: He was captured and enslaved by the Zhentarim.

Jannath_113.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_113.text: And you just left him there? Anything could have happened by now!

Jannath_130.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_130.text: Oh, my poor Oskar, how ever will I bring you home?

Jannath_190.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_190.context: NodeContext: Deeply upset, maintaining a polite 'stiff upper lip'

Jannath_162.speaker: Player
Jannath_162.text: He was working for the Zhentarim. It got him killed.

Jannath_38.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_38.text: What did he get himself tangled up in? Silly, silly boy.
Jannath_38.context: NodeContext: Shocked, angry but trying not to let it show

Jannath_10.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_10.text: Perhaps I'm equally foolish, to have believed he cared for me, and not the contents of my coffers.

Jannath_35.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_35.text: At least you've done me the favour of not having to worry about him any further. Take this - get it out of my sight.

Jannath_238.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_238.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I have guests to attend to.

Jannath_85.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_85.text: Ah. I see I've managed to lose my engagement ring already. Saves me the bother of tossing it away.

Jannath_82.speaker: Player
Jannath_82.text: He's in the Guildhall, working with the Zhentarim.

Jannath_95.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_95.text: Is this some kind of joke? Oskar's in the city, and he's a criminal?

Jannath_144.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_144.text: Oh, that stupid boy. If that's the reason he called off our engagement, then good bloody riddance to him.

Jannath_79.speaker: Player
Jannath_79.text: He ran away from your wedding because he was in love with someone else.

Jannath_15.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_15.text: I should have known. Gods, what a fool he took me for all those years.

Jannath_102.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_102.text: I'm sorry. I think I need a moment.
Jannath_102.context: NodeContext: Stunned and saddened by what she's been told, but maintaining a stiff upper lip

Jannath_127.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_127.text: So. First you save my husband, then you save our marriage. I can't tell you how grateful I am.

Jannath_189.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_189.context: NodeContext: Curt. In a bad mood - broken up with husband

Jannath_226.speaker: Player
Jannath_226.text: What will you do once Oskar is gone?

Jannath_92.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_92.text: The same thing I did before he arrived: enjoy my bloody life. Go to galleries. Drink fine wine. Enjoy a home not ravaged by a psychotic ghost.

Jannath_125.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_125.text: I'm done with him, and this whole sorry business. Now please - I have a house to get back in order.
Jannath_125.context: NodeContext: angry, but not at the player. Wants to get on with things.

Jannath_6.speaker: Player
Jannath_6.text: Watch your tone. I'm not the one to blame for this.

Jannath_47.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_47.text: I'll speak however I bloody like in my own house. If you don't like it, you're very welcome to leave with Oskar.

Jannath_200.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_200.text: Did you find anything in Oskar's atelier?

Jannath_3.speaker: Player
Jannath_3.text: A letter from Mystic Carrion. Oskar had dealings with him.

Jannath_142.speaker: Player
Jannath_142.text: A letter from someone named 'Mystic Carrion'.

Jannath_94.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_94.context: NodeContext: Someone she's familiar with, and despises

Jannath_119.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_119.text: Carrion calls himself a 'spirit medium'. His morbid services are something of a fad among the nobility. From what I've heard, it's invitation only.
Jannath_119.context: NodeContext: Finds everything about this ridiculous

Jannath_101.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_101.text: He has a mansion, down near the water. A forsaken place, dank and decayed as he is.

Jannath_218.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_218.text: You must find Mystic Carrion. If he's responsible for this mess, he can bloody well clean it up!

Jannath_58.speaker: Player
Jannath_58.text: There's a painting of his former lover, hidden in a side chamber.

Jannath_152.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_152.text: Perhaps I asked too much, making him let her go so quickly.
Jannath_152.context: NodeContext: Hiding how much this hurts her

Jannath_27.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_27.text: His lovesickness will pass, with time. Did you find anything else?

Jannath_215.speaker: Player
Jannath_215.text: Plenty of paintings. The work of an amateur.

Jannath_107.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_107.text: If I wanted to hear your artistic opinions, I'd ask for them.

Jannath_228.speaker: Player
Jannath_228.text: Some valuable pieces. You should sell them.

Jannath_20.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_20.text: Did you find anything that might help Oskar?
Jannath_20.context: NodeContext: Forced to be more specific, irritated

Jannath_202.speaker: Player
Jannath_202.text: Some beautiful pieces of art. Oskar is truly talented.

Jannath_60.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_60.text: Of course - my husband is a visionary. But did you find anything that might help him?
Jannath_60.context: NodeContext: Forced to be more specific, irritated

Jannath_197.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_197.text: Please don't give up. There has to be something.

Jannath_212.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_212.text: Did you speak with Carrion? Has he provided a cure?

Jannath_0.speaker: Player
Jannath_0.text: Oh, I killed him. He won't be inflicting any more possessions on unwitting patrons.

Jannath_174.speaker: Player
Jannath_174.text: He will, so long as I do something for him first.

Jannath_80.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_80.text: Gods only know what tricks that man will pull to serve himself. Still, if that's the only way to help Oskar, we have no choice.

Jannath_105.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_105.text: Whatever he's asked, do it quickly. I don't know how much longer Oskar can bear this...

Jannath_154.speaker: Player
Jannath_154.text: He's demanding a lot of gold before he'll give it to me.

Jannath_50.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_50.text: Poor Oskar. Held to ransom again...

Jannath_242.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_242.text: Carrion bloody well knows I'll never give him a penny. Was there no other means of persuading him?

Jannath_123.speaker: Player
Jannath_123.text: Oskar's body is under immense strain. He won't survive without it.

Jannath_213.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_213.text: Ugh, so be it. He's a foul creature to cause such misery and then expect payment to put it right.
Jannath_213.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jannath hands over the gold to the player (unseen)

Jannath_43.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_43.text: Carrion did this to him in the first place. How dare he expect payment to put it right?
Jannath_43.context: NodeContext: A glimpse of true, passionate anger from her (directed at Carrion, not the player in front of her)

Jannath_88.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_88.text: You must find some other way. Better yet, make Carrion pay for it.
Jannath_88.context: NodeContext: Steely determination, implying she wouldn't mind you solving it violently

Jannath_220.speaker: Player
Jannath_220.text: I haggled him down to this price. It's his best offer.

Jannath_177.speaker: Player
Jannath_177.text: If you truly loved Oskar, this would be a trifling sum to save him.

Jannath_69.speaker: Player
Jannath_69.text: You really care more of coin than another's life? Heartless.

Jannath_240.speaker: Player
Jannath_240.text: I have a Torch of Revocation. It should be enough to dispel the spirit.

Jannath_178.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_178.text: Then what are you waiting for? Do it!

Jannath_121.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_121.text: Go on, then. Why are you still here talking to me?

Jannath_216.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_216.text: Oskar, my sweet love. What have you done to him?

Jannath_230.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_230.text: I don't know what god sent you, but you have my thanks -
Jannath_230.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken for her lover, appealing to the player

Jannath_151.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_151.text: Wait - you're the one who saved Oskar from those bandits, aren't you? I've seen your face in his sketches.

Jannath_36.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_36.text: Please - you must help him again. Oskar's been possessed.

Jannath_173.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_173.text: There's no natural explanation for it. Some malevolent creature has taken hold of him, I'm sure of it.

Jannath_1.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_1.text: You've given him some respite, but when he wakes, it will return. It always does.

Jannath_157.speaker: Player
Jannath_157.text: He needs a doctor, not an adventurer.

Jannath_167.speaker: Player
Jannath_167.text: He's too dangerous. A merciful death is the best I can offer.

Jannath_163.speaker: Player
Jannath_163.text: Happy to help. Any idea where I should start?

Jannath_217.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_217.text: Most of what he says is complete gibberish, of course, but when he does make any kind of sense, he mentions the atelier.

Jannath_146.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_146.text: I've not been up there in days. The last time I tried, the walls started bleeding, and a portrait of my mother tried to bite me.

Jannath_72.speaker: Player
Jannath_72.text: Fine, I'll do it. But I need his debt settled, and more.

Jannath_227.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_227.text: Gold is no object, when it comes to my husband's life. But first, you must cure him.
Jannath_227.context: NodeContext: Stifling her annoyance that you're bringing up money at a time like this

Jannath_186.speaker: Player
Jannath_186.text: This time, Oskar's on his own.

Jannath_128.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_128.text: You might be ready to abandon Oskar, but I'm not.

Jannath_234.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_234.text: I hope you're enjoying my little open house. Is there something I can do for you?

Jannath_247.speaker: Lady Jannath
Jannath_247.text: It broke him - not long after you left. There's nothing more to be done but grieve.

PossessionScene_2.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionScene_2.text: Oskar, if you're still in there - listen to my voice! This is not you, please let me help you!

PossessionScene_5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
PossessionScene_5.text: All I hear is the grunting of a swine. Come closer so I can rip out your filthy tongue.

PossessionScene_1.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionScene_1.text: Stop this. I love you, Oskar. And I know you love me.

PossessionScene_4.speaker: Oskar Fevras
PossessionScene_4.text: It's your gold I love, hog-wife. But all the riches in Faerûn wouldn't be enough to make a life with you worth living.

PossessionScene_3.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionScene_3.text: Gods aid me, he does not mean the things he says.

PossessionScene_0.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionScene_0.text: You! Help subdue him - but be gentle. He's not to blame!

AD_DoormanComplaining_0.speaker: Doorman Phubbs
AD_DoormanComplaining_0.text: I don't know how Mr Mnemonis does it, standing out there all day.
AD_DoormanComplaining_0.context: NodeContext: To self. Impressed at his boss's fortitude

AD_DoormanComplaining_1.speaker: Doorman Phubbs
AD_DoormanComplaining_1.text: Perhaps I should speak to Mr Mnemonis about a promotion...
AD_DoormanComplaining_1.context: NodeContext: To self, forming a plan

AD_DoormanComplaining_2.speaker: Doorman Phubbs
AD_DoormanComplaining_2.text: Can't wait for this shift to end. Feet are killing me.
AD_DoormanComplaining_2.context: NodeContext: Mild complaint, not particularly bothered. To self.

AD_DoormanComplaining_3.speaker: Doorman Phubbs
AD_DoormanComplaining_3.text: I've more to offer than standing guard all day. A chamberlain, maybe.
AD_DoormanComplaining_3.context: NodeContext: To self, forming a plan

AD_AtelierPortrait_006_0.text: I'll smear your flesh on this canvas.

Servant_0.speaker: Furbleston
Servant_0.text: If things are not to your satisfaction, saer, speak to Lady Jannath.

Servant_1.speaker: Furbleston
Servant_1.text: My apologies, saer. I must continue serving from the kitchen.

AD_SpiritComment_Turn2_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
AD_SpiritComment_Turn2_0.text: You don't know what pain is, Oskar. Let me show you.
AD_SpiritComment_Turn2_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, tormented - active combat AD

AD_HighServantAlone_0.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_HighServantAlone_0.text: Where am I going to find a replacement with the city gates barred?

AD_HighServantAlone_1.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_HighServantAlone_1.text: An advertisement in the Mouth, perhaps. No, their readers are hardly the right calibre.
AD_HighServantAlone_1.context: NodeContext: Toying with an idea, then dismissing it

AD_HighServantAlone_2.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_HighServantAlone_2.text: Why does Tarhun hire such people? They're clearly incorrigible.

AD_HighServantAlone_3.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_HighServantAlone_3.text: *Sigh.* He's too soft beneath those scales. Just like Lady Jannath.
AD_HighServantAlone_3.context: NodeContext: Start with a sigh. Then with affection

AD_NoblesGossiping_1.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_1.text: I believe it's your turn to throw the next get-together.

AD_NoblesGossiping_7.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_7.text: I think not. How is one to throw a half-decent party without a florist?
AD_NoblesGossiping_7.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious, this is a BIG issue

AD_NoblesGossiping_4.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_4.text: Mine travelled all the way from Neverwinter, to be turned away at the gate. It's outrageous.
AD_NoblesGossiping_4.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious, this is a BIG issue

AD_NoblesGossiping_12.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_12.text: You must take this to Lord Gortash. He's a man who will see sense.
AD_NoblesGossiping_12.context: NodeContext: Outraged at what he's just heard

AD_NoblesGossiping_2.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_2.text: I came all the way from the Upper City for this little viewing of hers, and she's holding back on us.
AD_NoblesGossiping_2.context: NodeContext: Hushed, doesn't want to be overheard

AD_NoblesGossiping_6.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_6.text: I know for a fact she has an original Yapswurt hidden away. I've seen it.
AD_NoblesGossiping_6.context: NodeContext: Hushed, doesn't want to be overheard

AD_NoblesGossiping_14.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_14.text: Typical. The least she could do is have it on display. How else is one to buy it from her?

AD_NoblesGossiping_3.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_3.text: I find it hard to believe she's still pining over that commoner.
AD_NoblesGossiping_3.context: NodeContext: Hushed, doesn't want to be overheard

AD_NoblesGossiping_0.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_0.text: She should have married my cousin, as I suggested. He has plenty of land out in Amn.

AD_NoblesGossiping_13.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_13.text: An Amnian wedding? Now that would be a party.

AD_NoblesGossiping_10.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_10.text: Tell me, has anything caught your eye?

AD_NoblesGossiping_5.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_5.text: Certainly not the lobster. I haven't seen one in hours!
AD_NoblesGossiping_5.context: NodeContext: Thinks himself the height of wit

AD_NoblesGossiping_8.speaker: Saer Dokksill
AD_NoblesGossiping_8.text: Oh, very good. Very good. Yes, Fireliia keeps a rather lax house, doesn't she?
AD_NoblesGossiping_8.context: NodeContext: Finds this very droll, small laugh at the beginning

AD_NoblesGossiping_9.speaker: Impurto Nexim
AD_NoblesGossiping_9.text: I wouldn't stand for it under my roof. Lazy little serfs.

AD_NoblesArguing_3.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AD_NoblesArguing_3.text: Say that again, you... you... peasant .

AD_NoblesArguing_2.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
AD_NoblesArguing_2.text: That's rich, coming from you. Or rather, it isn't.
AD_NoblesArguing_2.context: NodeContext: Smug, making a joke about his rival's lost fortune

AD_NoblesArguing_1.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AD_NoblesArguing_1.text: That's it - outside! We settle this as gentlemen!
AD_NoblesArguing_1.context: NodeContext: Incandescent with rage, challenging him to a duel

AD_NoblesArguing_0.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
AD_NoblesArguing_0.context: NodeContext: Sigh at the beginning. Thinks this is all ridiculous

GossipingCook_001_0.speaker: Hargin Jooli
GossipingCook_001_0.text: Stop rushing me. I'll go back when I'm ready.

GossipingCook_001_1.speaker: Hargin Jooli
GossipingCook_001_1.text: If you're hungry, go to the kitchen. I'm on a break.

PAD_GottenPortrait_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GottenPortrait_0.text: A good likeness. Though I prefer the real thing.

OskarPostCombat_67.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_67.text: My love, sweet Fireliia. I can explain everything.

OskarPostCombat_44.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_44.text: I don't want to hear it - you nearly got us killed. Oh gods, I'll be a laughing stock when this comes out.

OskarPostCombat_79.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_79.text: But my love, I did it for us. How else was I to put her behind me?
OskarPostCombat_79.context: NodeContext: Genuinely baffled, thought he did the right thing

OskarPostCombat_69.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_69.text: My friend here can vouch for me. For how seriously I took our marriage.
OskarPostCombat_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oskar nods his head, silently pleading for the player to back him up

OskarPostCombat_47.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_47.text: He genuinely respects you, Lady Jannath. Even if he is an idiot.

OskarPostCombat_7.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_7.text: Hmm. I suppose one last chance won't do any harm.

OskarPostCombat_73.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_73.text: You ran away to avoid it. Your marriage is a sham.

OskarPostCombat_11.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to Jannath, knows he's in deep trouble nowNodeContext: Utter disbelief and panic

OskarPostCombat_72.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_72.text: I want you gone from this house by nightfall.

OskarPostCombat_50.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_50.text: If being married to me is so awful, then you can bloody well fend for yourself.

OskarPostCombat_55.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_55.text: Erm, yes. He always said how much he valued your relationship...

OskarPostCombat_12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_12.text: Ahem. Well, I confess, at first I saw you as a patron first, and a lover second. But now I feel differently.
OskarPostCombat_12.context: NodeContext: Awkward, trying to justify himself

OskarPostCombat_85.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_85.text: Is that so? And what exactly changed your mind?
OskarPostCombat_85.context: NodeContext: Not yet ready to forgive him

OskarPostCombat_77.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_77.text: Please, my darling. Give me one final chance?

OskarPostCombat_15.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_15.text: I suppose you aren't the one to blame in all this. Though you've got a lot of grovelling to do.
OskarPostCombat_15.context: NodeContext: Witha  sigh at the start - reluctantly forgiving him

OskarPostCombat_62.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_62.text: I think it's best you go back to your painting for a while, Oskar. I need some space.

OskarPostCombat_60.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_60.text: Of course, my darling. I completely understand.

OskarPostCombat_34.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_34.text: When you're recovered from our little skirmish, join me up there, my friend. I believe we've a debt to settle.
OskarPostCombat_34.context: NodeContext: A bit embarassed, trying to sount positive about the 'debt' (he'll make a painting of you)

OskarPostCombat_38.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_38.text: This is between the two of you.

OskarPostCombat_14.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_14.text: That's just the problem, isn't it? It was never just the two of us.
OskarPostCombat_14.context: NodeContext: Like this is some bitter joke

OskarPostCombat_58.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_58.text: I know we're neither of us in our first flush of youth, but this... It's untenable.
OskarPostCombat_58.context: NodeContext: An unhappy conclusion, taking control of her fate

OskarPostCombat_65.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_65.text: Perhaps your next patron will be more forgiving than I.

OskarPostCombat_29.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_29.text: If you want my relationship advice, that's going to cost extra.

OskarPostCombat_35.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_35.text: Your friend is as cynical as you are, Oskar.
OskarPostCombat_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: With an eyebrow raiseNodeContext: Like this is some bitter joke

OskarPostCombat_24.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_24.text: I had hoped there was more to our relationship than the size of my coffers. Clearly I was mistaken.
OskarPostCombat_24.context: NodeContext: An unhappy conclusion, taking control of her fate

OskarPostCombat_51.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_51.text: No doubt you'll land on your feet. Or some other foolish noble will pick you up.

OskarPostCombat_21.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_21.text: I understand, Fireliia. And truly - I am sorry.

OskarPostCombat_75.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_75.text: You may as well have this - consider it payment, for allowing me to see the truth at last.
OskarPostCombat_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lady Jannath removes her wedding ring and hands it to the player (can be unseen if this can't be done in booth)

OskarPostCombat_71.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_71.text: Improvise a song detailing Oskar's love and devotion for Fireliia.

OskarPostCombat_78.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_78.text: Oskar... this song. Is it true?
OskarPostCombat_78.context: NodeContext: she's just heard a  beautiful song about how her husband *does* lover after being given evidence otherwise

OskarPostCombat_42.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_42.text: Oh, you - err. (Why on earth did you sing?)
OskarPostCombat_42.context: NodeContext: italics are whispered, chastising someone who's just burst out into terrible song

OskarPostCombat_23.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_23.text: Words as empty as the tune is tired. I think we're done here.

OskarPostCombat_30.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_30.text: Gods, what a mess I've made of it all.

OskarPostCombat_54.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_54.text: My sweet Fireliia. I've been a rotten fool, haven't I? And yet you never left my side...

OskarPostCombat_81.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_81.text: It will take more than a ghost to scare me away. Though I wish you'd come to me sooner.
OskarPostCombat_81.context: NodeContext: A bit annoyed, but not enough to escalate things further

OskarPostCombat_83.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_83.text: I - I'd like to stay. I confess, I never felt ours was a marriage of substance. I rather thought you just liked me for my art.

OskarPostCombat_39.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_39.text: That's it? You're just going to forgive him?

OskarPostCombat_82.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_82.text: I'm no fool. I know Oskar loved another when we met. But when we made our vows, I meant them.

OskarPostCombat_45.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_45.text: Throughout my ordeal, I saw how tenderly you cared for me. Even at my worst, you never left my side.
OskarPostCombat_45.context: NodeContext: 'Condition' referring to his being possessed by the ghost of his dead lover

OskarPostCombat_43.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_43.text: Truly, you were the one who saved me. I'm so sorry, my darling.
OskarPostCombat_43.context: NodeContext: Genuine apology, but he can't quite help caveating it at the end

OskarPostCombat_8.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_8.text: I wish you both a long and happy marriage.

OskarPostCombat_27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_27.text: Please - before you go. I must pay you back.

OskarPostCombat_57.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_57.text: Come upstairs, to my atelier. I promise you'll leave with something priceless. Immortality.

OskarPostCombat_20.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_20.text: Jannath deserves more than an apology for what you put her through.

OskarPostCombat_33.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_33.text: A debt I'll spend a lifetime repaying.
OskarPostCombat_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking tenderly at Lady Jannath

OskarPostCombat_76.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_76.text: As for you, my noble friend - our account can be settled far more quickly.

OskarPostCombat_80.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_80.text: Excuse me? I saved you. And I need paying for it.

OskarPostCombat_41.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_41.text: But of course. I'm a man of my word, and the word was 'compensation'.

OskarPostCombat_56.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_56.text: Saccharine nonsense. You two make me sick.

OskarPostCombat_70.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_70.text: Romance isn't for everyone, I suppose. Still - you brought us back together, and for that, I can't thank you enough.

OskarPostCombat_28.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_28.text: At least you'll have a great story to tell the grandchildren.

OskarPostCombat_66.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarPostCombat_66.text: Perhaps not. I think this sorry episode is best left out of the family history. Though it was quite the adventure.

OskarPostCombat_63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_63.text: Such torments I put you through, my love, but even at my worst, you never left my side. I'm so very sorry.

OskarPostCombat_74.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_74.text: What a touching reunion. Now, about my payment...

OskarPostCombat_52.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_52.text: My love, sweet Fireliia. She is gone, and I am left with nothing.

OskarPostCombat_59.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_59.text: I need some time to process this. To understand... what I've done.

OskarPostCombat_3.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_3.text: I'd say you've done well out of all this. Lady Jannath's estate is yours now.

OskarPostCombat_4.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_4.text: No, no it isn't. She was always a pragmatist, and made sure our marriage contract left her estate protected.
OskarPostCombat_4.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not bitter about it

OskarPostCombat_26.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_26.text: Some distant cousin will no doubt claim the house in due course, and I'll be on the streets once more.
OskarPostCombat_26.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not bitter about it

OskarPostCombat_84.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_84.text: Don't be too hard on yourself. Mystic Carrion manipulated you.

OskarPostCombat_9.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_9.text: Perhaps. But he only preyed on what was already there.

OskarPostCombat_22.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_22.text: I suppose you came here to ask for your portrait?

OskarPostCombat_64.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_64.text: I'm afraid I'm rather lacking inspiration at the moment. Perhaps my sketchbook will be sufficient payment - it might be worth something, one day.
OskarPostCombat_64.context: NodeContext: In shock, trying his best

OskarPostCombat_6.speaker: Player
OskarPostCombat_6.text: There are consequences to our actions. Especially selfish ones.

OskarPostCombat_46.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_46.text: Of course. And I thought I'd become rather good at avoiding them. With your help, of course.

OskarPostCombat_17.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_17.text: Unfortunately, I'm rather stumped on this one. It's all over. All gone.

OskarPostCombat_25.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarPostCombat_25.text: Of course. We had an agreement, didn't we? I was supposed to paint your portrait.

AngryNobles_0.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AngryNobles_0.text: Give me back my gold. I spent half my fortune on that bloody painting of yours!
AngryNobles_0.context: NodeContext: Really pissed off, about to blow his fuse - this man owes him a refund

AngryNobles_2.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
AngryNobles_2.text: As well you should have. Because it isn't a counterfeit!
AngryNobles_2.context: NodeContext: angry, slightly amused at the misfortune of the man he's arguing with

AngryNobles_1.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AngryNobles_1.text: Then you leave me no choice, sir. We settle this outside. Now!
AngryNobles_1.context: NodeContext: Really pissed off, challenging the other man to a duel

PAD_FurnitureThrown_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FurnitureThrown_0.text: Who in the hells threw that?
PAD_FurnitureThrown_0.context: NodeContext: Fairly active/urgent - a poltergeist threw a chair at your head

AD_NobleLookingAtPainting_1.speaker: Lady Flytebon
AD_NobleLookingAtPainting_1.text: The way the subject looks beyond the viewer...

AD_NobleLookingAtPainting_2.speaker: Lady Flytebon
AD_NobleLookingAtPainting_2.text: The perfect shade for my second drawing room.

AD_NobleLookingAtPainting_3.speaker: Lady Flytebon
AD_NobleLookingAtPainting_3.text: I wonder how much Fireliia wants for it.

AD_TarhunMurmuring_0.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
AD_TarhunMurmuring_0.text: She will call for me soon, I'm sure of it.

AD_PortraitInteraction_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortraitInteraction_0.text: *The portrait is ice-cold to the touch, filling you with a sense of overwhelming dread. So why is the woman smiling?*

PAD_ReactionPortraitZombies_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionPortraitZombies_0.text: Ah! A little true to life for my tastes.

AD_HighServantWithBailey_1.speaker: Servant Bailey
AD_HighServantWithBailey_1.text: Does Mr Mnemonis know about this, sir?

AD_HighServantWithBailey_0.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
AD_HighServantWithBailey_0.text: He doesn't. And I won't tell him - so long as you pull yourself together.

Noble_001_0.speaker: Saer Dokksill
Noble_001_0.text: I'd recognise those mischievous eyes anywhere - the great art dealer Vlemin. I love your work.

Noble_001_1.speaker: Saer Dokksill
Noble_001_1.text: You must be here incognito. Scouting new talent. Fear not - your secret's safe with me.

Noble_001_2.speaker: Saer Dokksill
Noble_001_2.text: Seen anything that takes your fancy?

AD_SpiritComment_Turn3_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
AD_SpiritComment_Turn3_0.text: Oskar dies with me. Such a pretty picture we'll make.
AD_SpiritComment_Turn3_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, toying with Oskar - active combat AD

AD_AtelierPortrait_011_0.text: (It burns. It burns. You will burn too.)

Noble_002_0.speaker: Impurto Nexim
Noble_002_0.text: If you see Lady Jannath, do tell her that we've run out of lobster, won't you?

Noble_002_1.speaker: Impurto Nexim
Noble_002_1.text: Don't you know not to interrupt your betters.

PossessionAD_0.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionAD_0.text: Now is your last chance to run.

PossessionAD_3.speaker: Oskar Fevras
PossessionAD_3.text: Don't be like that, darling. Offer our guests something to drink. Maybe your blood.

PossessionAD_2.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionAD_2.text: If you have the courage to stay, help subdue him - but be careful. I could not stand to lose him.

PossessionAD_1.speaker: Lady Jannath
PossessionAD_1.text: Please. This isn't his fault - help me subdue him.

PossessionAD_5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
PossessionAD_5.text: Quiet, woman! I'll scratch out your eyes.

InterruptedFiring_15.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_15.text: You've shamed House Jannath, and me, for the last time, Bailey. You're awkward, slow, and your tunic is buttoned wrong.

InterruptedFiring_8.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_8.text: Who the blazes? Ah. Sorry, saer, but this is a staff area. Whatever a guest might need is available downstairs.

InterruptedFiring_11.speaker: Player
InterruptedFiring_11.text: Is it the way of House Jannath for upper staff to abuse lower staff?

InterruptedFiring_7.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_7.text: With all due respect, saer, I've been chamberlain of House Jannath for almost ten years, and I think I know my duties.

InterruptedFiring_17.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_17.text: Bailey, here, has earned a severe reprimand, and as it's the third one this tenday, he's out.

InterruptedFiring_5.speaker: Player
InterruptedFiring_5.text: That's rude. Do you want me to report to your employer that a guest was shocked by your rudeness?

InterruptedFiring_18.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_18.text: No, no, of course not! You're right to reproach me. I shall give Bailey here another chance.

InterruptedFiring_9.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_9.text: This guest's concern has earned you another chance, Bailey. I'm sure you're grateful.

InterruptedFiring_12.speaker: Servant Bailey
InterruptedFiring_12.text: Yes, yes, thank you, saer! And I promise not to drop any more cutlery, chamberlain!

InterruptedFiring_6.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_6.text: Hmph. I've been Lady Jannath's chamberlain for nearly ten years, and she has always trusted my judgement with the staff.

InterruptedFiring_14.speaker: Player
InterruptedFiring_14.text: I don't like bullies. Apologise to this man or you'll regret it.

InterruptedFiring_19.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_19.text: Oh! Oh, well. If that's how it is, then Bailey, I'm afraid I spoke hastily to you.

InterruptedFiring_3.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_3.text: I will tolerate no bullying from a guest! Moderate your behaviour, saer, or the guard will eject you from the premises.

InterruptedFiring_13.speaker: Chamberlain Mercer
InterruptedFiring_13.text: Bailey, you're fired. You have five minutes to collect your things and get out the door.

InterruptedFiring_0.speaker: Servant Bailey
InterruptedFiring_0.text: Bloody hells! What am I going to tell Gladiss? She's going to kill me!

Souschef_0.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
Souschef_0.text: Shhh. You'll get me in trouble.
Souschef_0.context: NodeContext: On edge, just had an earful from the boss

Souschef_1.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
Souschef_1.text: No small talk in the kitchen. Chef's orders.
Souschef_1.context: NodeContext: On edge, just had an earful from the boss

AD_Servant_3.speaker: Furbleston
AD_Servant_3.text: Whatever you like, our kitchen can prepare it, saer.

TarhunMnemonis_4.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_4.text: Whatever shall I do without Lady Jannath? You must excuse me...

TarhunMnemonis_7.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_7.text: Welcome to Lady Jannath's celebration of the arts.

TarhunMnemonis_20.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_20.text: Decidedly not. I have more to do with dustbrushes than paintbrushes - I am Lady Jannath's butler.

TarhunMnemonis_22.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_22.text: Lady Jannath is a dedicated patron of the arts. She doesn't care for status or wealth, human or dragonborn - if you have talent, she'll nurture it.
TarhunMnemonis_22.context: NodeContext: Filled with pride at serving such a woman

TarhunMnemonis_16.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_16.text: Today's event is a public showing of many fine pieces she has commissioned.

TarhunMnemonis_1.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_1.text: I have information concerning Lady Jannath's fiancé, Oskar.

TarhunMnemonis_41.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_41.text: Ah. A delicate matter. You will find milady upstairs.

TarhunMnemonis_23.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_23.text: Do you have any icons depicting Bhaal?

TarhunMnemonis_30.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_30.text: Glowing skull. Twelve-to-thirteen swimming blood droplets. Bhaal!

TarhunMnemonis_59.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_59.text: It's quite old-fashioned, but it's about to become all the rage again.

TarhunMnemonis_28.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_28.text: Good. That junk is evil - don't sell it!

TarhunMnemonis_0.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_0.text: Your mistress has no respect for the Gate's esteemed history.

TarhunMnemonis_32.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_32.text: Do you have any scrimshawed pieces?

TarhunMnemonis_40.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_40.text: I'm afraid I'm not familiar with that particular style.

TarhunMnemonis_33.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_33.text: It's bone engraved with intricate designs. It's popular in the Underdark.

TarhunMnemonis_62.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_62.context: NodeContext: the 'i see' of a professional butler thinking 'holy shit this person is insane'

TarhunMnemonis_54.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_54.text: Well, tell me you at least have some bone sculptures - with the marrow inside, of course.

TarhunMnemonis_53.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_53.text: It's hardly a celebration of the arts without scrimshaw.

TarhunMnemonis_18.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_18.text: I'm afraid Lady Jannath is not a patron of such unique artistry.
TarhunMnemonis_18.context: NodeContext: the response of a professional butler who clearly thinks the player is insane

TarhunMnemonis_47.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_47.text: Feel free to browse today's event - while we lack this scrimshaw, I'm sure you'll find something to pique your interest.
TarhunMnemonis_47.context: NodeContext: bit of a grimace - thinks the player is nuts.

TarhunMnemonis_10.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_10.text: Lady Jannath would prefer to keep this affair private. I'm sure you understand.
TarhunMnemonis_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a small, formal bow

TarhunMnemonis_27.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_27.text: Enter, if that is your wish. Personally, I would advise you against it.
TarhunMnemonis_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Greets you with a small, formal bow - respectfulNodeContext: Trying to sound composed, but clearly unsettled by something

TarhunMnemonis_29.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_29.text: You are welcome to enter, quietly. We are a house in mourning.
TarhunMnemonis_29.context: NodeContext: Respectful, speaking to a superior

TarhunMnemonis_34.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_34.text: Good day to you. I apologise, but Lady Jannath is not currently welcoming visitors.
TarhunMnemonis_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Greets you with a small, formal bow - respectfulNodeContext: Trying to sound composed, but clearly unsettled by something

TarhunMnemonis_35.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_35.text: If you are here with regards to her recent marriage, you may leave any gifts or warm wishes with me, and I will ensure she receives them.
TarhunMnemonis_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tarhun flinches as what sounds like a vase shatters against the door behind him. He continues his thought.NodeContext: Doing his best to stay composed

TarhunMnemonis_56.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: A woman's scream pierces the air as we hear another distant crash of breaking furniture. Tahrun flinches again, more visibily recoiling than the first instance. He looks over his shoulder, frustrated. SFX - Lady Jannath screams loudlyNodeContext: All decorum forgotten - just slips out. Startled and stressed

TarhunMnemonis_25.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_25.text: Ahem. Forgive me. As you can hear, Lady Jannath is indisposed at present. Please come back another time.
TarhunMnemonis_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clears his throat into his hand, regaining his composed stanceNodeContext: Attempting to regain his composure, clearly stressed. Clears his throat at the start of the line

TarhunMnemonis_49.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_49.text: Tarhun Mnemonis, butler to Lady Jannath - esteemed patron of the arts. At least, I am most of the time...
TarhunMnemonis_49.context: NodeContext: A hint of pride - he worships the woman he serves

TarhunMnemonis_60.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_60.text: Your discretion is admirable. Now tell me what's going on here.

TarhunMnemonis_21.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_21.text: Ahem. Well, of course, that wouldn't be my place to say.
TarhunMnemonis_21.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay composed, frustrated

TarhunMnemonis_11.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_11.text: I 'indispose' people all the time. I know what that means.

TarhunMnemonis_5.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_5.text: I assure you, absolutely nothing untoward is happening inside.

TarhunMnemonis_57.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_57.text: Lady Jannath wishes for some time alone with her new spouse, and has sent her staff on holiday accordingly.
TarhunMnemonis_57.context: NodeContext: 'holiday' as though the idea is abhorrent

TarhunMnemonis_58.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_58.text: Were you to try and enter, there'd be nothing I could do to stop you. After all, I am on holiday.
TarhunMnemonis_58.context: NodeContext: Implicitly asking you to go inside

TarhunMnemonis_2.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_2.text: Does she often send her entire staff away at such short notice?

TarhunMnemonis_43.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_43.text: Ordinarily, no - though such generosity would not be out of character. But in this instance, I fear she has other motivations - motivations I will not talk about.

TarhunMnemonis_19.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_19.text: Funny way to spend your holiday, stood right outside your workplace...

TarhunMnemonis_37.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_37.text: In ordinary circumstances I'd appreciate her generosity more fully, but... well, I prefer to be here for when she changes her mind.

TarhunMnemonis_38.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_38.text: Fair enough. I'll leave them to it.

TarhunMnemonis_50.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_50.context: NodeContext: Still playing along, privately disappointed you won't help

TarhunMnemonis_61.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_61.text: 'Indisposed'? It sounds like she's being murdered.

TarhunMnemonis_3.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_3.text: I need to enter. I have business with Oskar.

TarhunMnemonis_48.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_48.text: One Oskar Fevras. An artist of some renown, I'm told. Usually by him.
TarhunMnemonis_48.context: NodeContext: With a detectable air of contempt, though not forgetting his place

TarhunMnemonis_24.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_24.text: Sounds like they're a very happy couple...

TarhunMnemonis_46.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_46.text: Do not be so crude. If that were the explanation, do you think I'd be stood waiting out here like some arthak dus?
TarhunMnemonis_46.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay composed - reigning in his outrage

TarhunMnemonis_15.speaker: Player
TarhunMnemonis_15.text: Your cuss words contain more truth than this human rhetoric. Speak plain.

TarhunMnemonis_17.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_17.text: You've a quick ear for truth, scalefriend. I'll not hide it from you.

TarhunMnemonis_55.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TarhunMnemonis_55.text: My apologies, but I cannot speak further. I have quite the mess to clean up.

DuelInterruption_30.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_30.text: Oh good. An audience come to witness your stupidity.

DuelInterruption_44.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_44.text: Stop trying to distract me, and prepare yourself. We begin on my say!

DuelInterruption_38.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_38.text: Gorran here can't tell a fake painting from a real one. And he'd rather die than admit it.

DuelInterruption_26.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_26.text: Ridiculous - I'd know a fake from half a furlong away!

DuelInterruption_36.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_36.text: Then why did you buy it from me in the first place, you insufferable idiot?

DuelInterruption_19.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_19.text: Because - because - that's not the point! You sold me a fake, and you're going to pay for it. If not in gold, then in blood!

DuelInterruption_10.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_10.text: Sounds like a duel is the only answer.

DuelInterruption_12.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_12.text: Stop this, or I'm sticking both of your heads through that bloody painting.

DuelInterruption_5.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_5.text: Well, that's rather uncalled for. It was just a light spot of duelling.
DuelInterruption_5.context: NodeContext: Affronted, annoyed at your interruption

DuelInterruption_2.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_2.text: We'll settle this another time, Gorran. Try not to spend the rest of your fortune by then.

DuelInterruption_31.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_31.text: Why not just sell the fake to another gullible fool?

DuelInterruption_22.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_22.text: Yes, I suppose that's my only option, given I've clearly no hope of getting my gold back the right way.
DuelInterruption_22.context: NodeContext: with verbal side-eye at his friend who won't pay him back

DuelInterruption_39.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_39.text: Sell it, burn it, have your servants tuck you in at night with it - I don't care, so long as I never hear about it again.
DuelInterruption_39.context: NodeContext: Done with this ridiculous situation

DuelInterruption_37.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_37.text: It's settled then. Perhaps it's time I wrote to my cousin in Waterdeep...
DuelInterruption_37.context: NodeContext: Acting casual, going to sell his cousin a fake painting

DuelInterruption_25.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_25.text: How dare you? You - you blaggard!
DuelInterruption_25.context: NodeContext: Outraged at the player's calling him a gullible fool

DuelInterruption_32.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_32.context: NodeContext: Outraged that the player agreed with his opponent

DuelInterruption_33.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_33.text: You're both as stupid as each other. Duel away.

DuelInterruption_24.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_24.text: This ruffian wishes to harm us. I won't stand for it. Will you?

DuelInterruption_21.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_21.text: This can't be solved with words - only blades. Fight! WIN!

DuelInterruption_1.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_1.text: You are clearly novices, but I will serve as second for you both, if you wish.

DuelInterruption_47.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_47.text: No need, I'll finish this in one strike.

DuelInterruption_15.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_15.text: Do not sacrifice your lives on such petty grounds. They are too precious.

DuelInterruption_40.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_40.text: I... I suppose I'd rather not die over it. But you still owe me the gold.
DuelInterruption_40.context: NodeContext: Slightly abashed, embarassed at how things escalated. Other NPC owes him the gold, not the player

DuelInterruption_43.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_43.text: Fine. I'll speak with my financier, see if she can transfer it to your vault. You'll have it by tomorrow.
DuelInterruption_43.context: NodeContext: Very reluctantly agreeing to this

DuelInterruption_29.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
DuelInterruption_29.text: And I want my painting back.
