DuelInterruption_29.context: NodeContext: Adding final clause to an annoying agreement - been forced to provide a refund

DuelInterruption_3.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_3.text: Sounds like a duel is the only answer.

DuelInterruption_14.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
DuelInterruption_14.text: See? You're not getting out of this.

DuelInterruption_4.speaker: Player
DuelInterruption_4.text: I can't wait to see this.

OskarAlternativeState_30.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_30.text: You left me in that bloody Zhentarim camp to rot.

OskarAlternativeState_9.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_9.text: You're fortunate I've work to do, or I'd show you exactly where they like to stick a palette knife.

OskarAlternativeState_50.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_50.text: The Zhentarim, of course. I've learned a trick or two from them since you abandoned me in their filthy encampment.

OskarAlternativeState_58.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_58.text: I convinced them that a true artist cannot perform in captivity, and so we agreed to proceed on a mutually beneficial basis.

OskarAlternativeState_21.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_21.text: Hardly the line of work I expected to end up in, but I can say one thing for them - they understand the value of art.

OskarAlternativeState_7.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_7.text: Well, I'm not giving them away.

OskarAlternativeState_72.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_72.text: Aha. Well, I wouldn't put it in quite those terms. I'm simply a duplicator of artistic works that already exist.

OskarAlternativeState_27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_27.text: If people can't tell the difference between my work and the original, then who's to say it is any less precious than the real thing?

OskarAlternativeState_70.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_70.text: They are very reasonable people. I produce the work, and they handle the distribution.

OskarAlternativeState_45.speaker: Player
OskarAlternativeState_45.text: Why not just return to your patron?

OskarAlternativeState_20.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_20.text: Oh, I never asked. Why bother, when I'm finally an artist of independent means?

OskarAlternativeState_16.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_16.text: I think it's going rather well. I've more gold in my pockets now than I ever had begging for Lady Jannath's scraps.

OskarAlternativeState_12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_12.text: It's a shame, but then the curse of true originality was always to be undervalued.

OskarAlternativeState_24.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_24.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I've got orders to fulfil, and this Kalain won't forge itself.

OskarAlternativeState_47.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_47.text: Oh, and if you're thinking about selling that to anyone down here - forget it. They aren't as stupid as they look. Or as friendly.

OskarAlternativeState_36.speaker: Player
OskarAlternativeState_36.text: Ouch. I didn't take you for the violent type.

OskarAlternativeState_0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_0.text: Yes, well, enough time spent in violent captivity at the hands of brutal thugs will do that to a man.

OskarAlternativeState_51.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_51.text: Fortunately, the Zhentarim stopped threatening to break my fingers when they realised it would be bad for business.

OskarAlternativeState_65.speaker: Player
OskarAlternativeState_65.text: What are you doing in the Guildhall?

OskarAlternativeState_73.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_73.text: After you failed to rescue me from their encampment, the Zhentarim and I settled our differences, so to speak.

OskarAlternativeState_48.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_48.text: You'll find out for yourself if you get on the wrong side of them. The Zhentarim aren't much for subtlety.

OskarAlternativeState_59.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_59.text: They do, however, know the work of a master when they see it.

OskarAlternativeState_43.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_43.text: Hmm. You look rather more refined than the usual thugs walking these halls. I don't suppose you have any interest in fine art?

OskarAlternativeState_14.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_14.text: My name is Oskar Fevras, though I doubt you'll have heard it.

OskarAlternativeState_2.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_2.text: My stardom has waned somewhat recently, but I was once feted as one of the city's most promising artists.

OskarAlternativeState_10.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_10.text: These days my oeuvre is less original, shall we say, but no less in demand.

OskarAlternativeState_28.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_28.text: In fact, you're fortunate to have caught me just now. I've a rather special piece that's become unexpectedly available.

OskarAlternativeState_39.speaker: Player
OskarAlternativeState_39.text: Of course. There's nothing like art to soothe a troubled soul.

OskarAlternativeState_63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_63.text: Then perhaps I might be able to interest you in a rather special piece I've just completed. It's become unexpectedly available.

OskarAlternativeState_60.speaker: Player
OskarAlternativeState_60.text: I'm more interested in the purses required to buy such pieces.

OskarAlternativeState_11.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_11.text: Aha. Then perhaps you'd be interested in taking a look at my stock. I've a rather special piece that's become unexpectedly available.

OskarAlternativeState_18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_18.text: I assure you, it's identical to the original down to the finest brush stroke. A fine piece to hang on the wall of anyone you decide to sell it to.

OskarAlternativeState_29.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_29.text: Ah. We had a very interested party out in Waterdeep who, shall we say, commissioned the piece. But when the time came, she was unable to pay.

OskarAlternativeState_69.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_69.text: I hear parts of her have washed up as far away as Neverwinter.

OskarAlternativeState_35.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_35.text: Oh - and a word of advice. Don't try to sell it down here - I've already tried, and they aren't interested.

OskarAlternativeState_5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_5.text: Of course not! It's absolutely real - I painted it myself.

OskarAlternativeState_57.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_57.text: It is simply derived from an existing source of inspiration.

OskarAlternativeState_17.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_17.text: My good friend, do you know where you are? The Guildhall is no place for the morally squeamish.

OskarAlternativeState_76.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_76.text: If, however, you're open to the idea of supporting the arts, then we may do some fine business.

OskarAlternativeState_67.speaker: Player
OskarAlternativeState_67.text: I've no time for such distractions.

OskarAlternativeState_37.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_37.text: Well, culture isn't for everyone. Perhaps gold is of more value to you, yes?

OskarAlternativeState_13.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_13.text: I've a rather wonderful painting that's become unexpectedly available.

OskarAlternativeState_44.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarAlternativeState_44.text: Oh, wonderful. Back again, are we?
OskarAlternativeState_44.context: NodeContext: Super pissed off - you abandoned him with violent thugs. Low voice - doesn't want to be overheard

AD_AtelierPortrait_009_0.text: Look at me. Aren't I beautiful?

GossipingCook_002_0.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
GossipingCook_002_0.text: This is a private conversation, all right?
GossipingCook_002_0.context: NodeContext: Slightly nervous, got caught gossiping

GossipingCook_002_1.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
GossipingCook_002_1.text: Just a bit of harmless workplace gossip. We all do it.
GossipingCook_002_1.context: NodeContext: Slightly nervous, got caught gossiping

AD_GossipingStaff_11.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_11.text: How much you reckon Lady Jannath'll make out of those nobles upstairs?

AD_GossipingStaff_8.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
AD_GossipingStaff_8.text: Oh, I don't know. More than I can count on my fingers, that's for sure.

AD_GossipingStaff_9.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_9.text: Surprised she's not showing the big one, though. That'd fetch a pretty penny.

AD_GossipingStaff_4.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
AD_GossipingStaff_4.text: It was Master Oskar's favourite. She'll never sell that one.

AD_GossipingStaff_10.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_10.text: She should cut her losses. He ain't never coming back.

AD_GossipingStaff_12.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_12.text: You met that hoity-toity woman upstairs? She kept whinging that her wine tasted funny...
AD_GossipingStaff_12.context: NodeContext: Obvious where this is heading - he's pissed in her wine

AD_GossipingStaff_16.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
AD_GossipingStaff_16.text: No you didn't... did you? Go on, tell me what you did.
AD_GossipingStaff_16.context: NodeContext: Playing along, finds him hilarious

AD_GossipingStaff_2.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_2.text: Let's just say it had more in it than a few grapes.

AD_GossipingStaff_3.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
AD_GossipingStaff_3.text: Oh, you're filthy. I bet she still drank every drop.

AD_GossipingStaff_14.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_14.text: Still think Lady Jannath'll make you a lady's maid?

AD_GossipingStaff_13.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
AD_GossipingStaff_13.text: Oh, I've given up. I've scrubbed, I've washed, I've polished - all for nothing. She doesn't notice me.
AD_GossipingStaff_13.context: NodeContext: Making herself out to be a martyr

AD_GossipingStaff_6.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_6.text: I think you'd make a great lady's maid.

AD_GossipingStaff_0.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_0.text: Piece of cake. I just turn up and chop what I'm told to chop.

AD_GossipingStaff_1.speaker: 'Loose Lips' Cyrilla
AD_GossipingStaff_1.text: Like being back in the Guildhall, eh?
AD_GossipingStaff_1.context: NodeContext: Nudge and a wink vibe - she knows he used to be a guild thug

AD_GossipingStaff_5.speaker: Hargin Jooli
AD_GossipingStaff_5.text: Don't know what you're talking about.
AD_GossipingStaff_5.context: NodeContext: Changing the subject, worried they'll be overheard

AD_SpiritComment_Turn1_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
AD_SpiritComment_Turn1_0.text: That bastard boy will suffer for this. He is mine.
AD_SpiritComment_Turn1_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, bitter - active, combat AD

Noble_003_0.speaker: Lady Flytebon
Noble_003_0.text: It's rather hard to appreciate this piece when you keep interrupting me.

Noble_003_1.speaker: Lady Flytebon
Noble_003_1.text: I find it best to reflect on works like this in silence, don't you?
Noble_003_1.context: NodeContext: Hinting for you to leave them alone

PAD_SeenMasterpiece_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SeenMasterpiece_0.text: A fine painting. Should be worth its weight in gold.
PAD_SeenMasterpiece_0.context: NodeContext: whispered/to self - observing the value of a stealable item

AD_AtelierPortrait_Jannath_0.text: Take the piggy bank bitch. Burn her! Roast her!

AD_ChefsCooking_3.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_3.text: You served this to Lady Jannath? It's RAW!
AD_ChefsCooking_3.context: NodeContext: Very annoyed, about to fling the dish at the wall

AD_ChefsCooking_11.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_11.context: NodeContext: Nervous, trying to say the right thing.

AD_ChefsCooking_7.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_7.text: I can't serve apologies, can I? Make it again, and cook it this time.

AD_ChefsCooking_2.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_2.context: NodeContext: Regular voice, sad at being told off.

AD_ChefsCooking_5.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_5.text: Is your tongue half-baked too? Louder!

AD_ChefsCooking_14.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_14.context: NodeContext: Loud, forceful - been asked to speak up

AD_ChefsCooking_4.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_4.text: How many more mouths will we have to feed?

AD_ChefsCooking_8.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_8.text: As many as Lady Jannath desires. So keep cooking!

AD_ChefsCooking_9.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_9.text: Should I slice the radishes like this?

AD_ChefsCooking_6.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_6.text: No, no, no - thinner! Make them elegant, and make them count. Those are the last we have.

AD_ChefsCooking_10.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_10.text: Can't we just use something else?

AD_ChefsCooking_15.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_15.text: Spoken like the cook you are. I'll never make a chef of you.
AD_ChefsCooking_15.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - trying to teach the unteachable

AD_ChefsCooking_13.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_13.text: How did you become a chef, Chef?

AD_ChefsCooking_12.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_12.text: I trained in Duke Ravengard's kitchens, under Chef Dinethaar Marsh.
AD_ChefsCooking_12.context: NodeContext: Like we're supposed to have heard of this person. 'Dinethaar' pronunciation doesn't matter - not a character elsewhere in the game. Marsh as the regular word is said

AD_ChefsCooking_0.speaker: Falura the Sous-Chef
AD_ChefsCooking_0.text: Was Chef Marsh a good teacher?

AD_ChefsCooking_1.speaker: Chef Marjoram
AD_ChefsCooking_1.text: He was an efficient teacher. I have the burns to prove it.
AD_ChefsCooking_1.context: NodeContext: Correcting 'good' with 'efficient.' Grim in remembering his own suffering

Chef_0.speaker: Chef Marjoram
Chef_0.text: You shouldn't disturb painters at their easels, and you shouldn't disturb chefs in their kitchens.

Chef_2.speaker: Chef Marjoram
Chef_2.text: I have seventeen courses of delicacies to prepare. No distractions.

PAD_CarrionLetterReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_CarrionLetterReaction_0.text: Oskar sought help from Mystic Carrion. Might be worth investigating.

KerriAttacked_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
KerriAttacked_0.context: NodeContext: Furious, you attacked her unprovoked, she's about to attack you

AD_KerriComment_Turn3_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
AD_KerriComment_Turn3_0.text: Stay out of this. If I am Oskar's beloved, he will be mine.
AD_KerriComment_Turn3_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, aggressive - mid combat line. Aimed at the player this time, she'll kill you for getting in her way.

PAD_OskarEaselSeen_0.speaker: Player
PAD_OskarEaselSeen_0.text: A strange easel. There's some kind of mechanism attached.
PAD_OskarEaselSeen_0.context: NodeContext: Fairly active/urgent - a poltergeist threw a chair at your head

OskarMakesPortrait_9.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_9.text: My canvas is ready. Are you?

OskarMakesPortrait_14.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_14.text: Here they are - the hero of the hour.

OskarMakesPortrait_18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_18.text: My brushes are oiled, the canvas prepped, and you...
OskarMakesPortrait_18.context: NodeContext: Pumped, enthusiastic.  Struggling to find a polite word for what the player is wearing.

OskarMakesPortrait_34.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_34.text: Well, you're comfortable. That's the main thing. So, shall we begin?

OskarMakesPortrait_19.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_19.text: How long is this going to take?

OskarMakesPortrait_1.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_1.text: Oh, not long at all. I've rather a good memory for faces, and I've been sketching yours since my return.

OskarMakesPortrait_46.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_46.text: I just need to add the final touches, capture that unique twinkle in your eye. So, are you ready?

OskarMakesPortrait_51.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_51.text: Take as long as you need.

OskarMakesPortrait_22.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_22.text: There's something wrong with what I'm wearing?

OskarMakesPortrait_20.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_20.text: No, no, no. Of course not. And as an artist, I want to capture your true essence in this portrait - bloodstains and all.

OskarMakesPortrait_48.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_48.text: Of course, if you do want to freshen up first, I'm more than happy to wait. After all, it will be seen by generations to come.

OskarMakesPortrait_12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_12.text: Wonderful. Stand yourself just there and -
OskarMakesPortrait_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easelNodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easel

OskarMakesPortrait_28.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_28.text: And - voila! All it needs now is a name. Something to capture the spirit in which it was created.

OskarMakesPortrait_8.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_8.text: Let's not overcomplicate things. 'Portrait of an Adventurer.' is fine.

OskarMakesPortrait_32.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_32.text: A very traditional choice. Perfect for such a dignified hero as yourself.

OskarMakesPortrait_10.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_10.text: Certainly the defender of artists. A perfect title.

OskarMakesPortrait_0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_0.text: Perhaps not the thing you'll be remembered for, but a fine quality nonetheless. Adds a certain mystique, I think.

OskarMakesPortrait_3.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_3.text: Please, take it in for a moment. It's not every day one's face is preserved for posterity.

OskarMakesPortrait_43.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_43.text: 'Skald Supreme, Orator Extraordinaire, Master of Modesty'.

OskarMakesPortrait_5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_5.text: A tad... alliterative for my tastes, but who am I to judge?

OskarMakesPortrait_31.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_31.text: I'd rather my name weren't on it, to be quite honest.

OskarMakesPortrait_17.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_17.text: Heroic and modest. Then this shall be simply 'The Hero of Baldur's Gate'. A title I don't doubt you'll earn in due course.

OskarMakesPortrait_26.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_26.text: Call it whatever you want. I'm only going to sell it.

OskarMakesPortrait_37.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_37.text: You are? Ah. In that case, perhaps it's best left untitled.

OskarMakesPortrait_36.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_36.text: How about you just make sure I look good?

OskarMakesPortrait_42.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_42.text: Nothing could be simpler. Let's begin, shall we?
OskarMakesPortrait_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easelNodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easel

OskarMakesPortrait_53.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_53.text: On second thoughts, I might need a moment...

OskarMakesPortrait_33.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_33.text: Actually, I need a moment to freshen up.

OskarMakesPortrait_50.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_50.context: NodeContext: blown away by his own genius

OskarMakesPortrait_52.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_52.text: Ah. My friend. I'm sorry I dragged you into this unpleasantness. Hardly the way I hoped we would be reunited.

OskarMakesPortrait_35.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_35.text: But a true artist embraces his suffering. No doubt I'll be the finer painter for it. Eventually.
OskarMakesPortrait_35.context: NodeContext: Not convinced by his own argument

OskarMakesPortrait_4.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_4.text: I'll need a break from the city, of course. Let things blow over a bit, shall we say?

OskarMakesPortrait_15.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_15.text: Not forever, of course - I still owe you a portrait, and I intend to deliver on my promise! But first, I need to rediscover my inspiration.

OskarMakesPortrait_47.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_47.text: I think I'll try my hand at landscape painting. I've heard the Chult Peninsula has the most splendid sunsets.

OskarMakesPortrait_23.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_23.text: You can't just leave. You owe me a portrait.

OskarMakesPortrait_54.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_54.text: And one day, you shall have it. But I feel this particular phase of my artistic career has come to an unnatural conclusion, if you will.
OskarMakesPortrait_54.context: NodeContext: 'unnatural' playing on natural, has an air of finality

OskarMakesPortrait_6.speaker: Player
OskarMakesPortrait_6.text: You made Lady Jannath sound like a monster.

OskarMakesPortrait_13.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_13.text: I may have used some artistic licence in describing her to you, but make no mistake - her brow definitely twitched when I told her about Kerri.

OskarMakesPortrait_39.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_39.text: I seem to have rather a habit of overreacting. Still, such passion is where we find the most potent fuel for our creativity, is it not?

OskarMakesPortrait_55.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_55.text: If you came to ask about your portrait, I'm afraid it will have to wait.

OskarMakesPortrait_44.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_44.text: I'm going to take some time and reinvent myself - find a new source of inspiration.

OskarMakesPortrait_41.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_41.text: Well, every artist has their critics. Yours is an opinion I will at least bear in mind, given our shared adventures.

OskarMakesPortrait_56.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarMakesPortrait_56.text: Remember the name Oskar Fevras. It will be back on society's lips in no time.

AD_AngryNobleVictory_001_0.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
AD_AngryNobleVictory_001_0.text: Ugh. My laundress had better get this blood out.

PAD_ReactionPortraitZombiesAfter_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionPortraitZombiesAfter_0.text: Well - if I need a supply of undead warriors, I'll know where to find them.

PAD_ReactionPortraitZombiesAfter_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionPortraitZombiesAfter_1.text: That's that, then. Is this some new art trend I've not been made aware of?

AD_AtelierPortrait_002_0.context: NodeContext: Whispered, luring player in, then screaming loudly

KerriLeavesPortrait_0.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
KerriLeavesPortrait_0.text: Oskar... Where is he? Where is he?
KerriLeavesPortrait_0.context: NodeContext: Disoriented, enraged - out for revenge

AD_NoblesPreDuel_1.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
AD_NoblesPreDuel_1.text: You're making a big mistake, Gorran. This ends only one way.

AD_NoblesPreDuel_2.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AD_NoblesPreDuel_2.text: With you paying me back? Say you'll return the money, and we can both leave alive.

AD_NoblesPreDuel_3.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
AD_NoblesPreDuel_3.text: I simply don't have it. You see, I spent it. On a real painting.

AD_NoblesPreDuel_0.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
AD_NoblesPreDuel_0.text: You've mocked me enough, Delwaer. We begin in three, two -

OskarDispeledEvil_4.speaker: Narrator
OskarDispeledEvil_4.text: *The malevolent presence controlling Oskar seems to have abandoned him for now. He almost looks peaceful.*

OskarDispeledEvil_9.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_9.context: NodeContext: Guttural, possessed by Kerri's furious spirit

OskarDispeledEvil_28.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_28.text: Filthy bog troll. Keep your greasy paws to yourself!
OskarDispeledEvil_28.context: NodeContext: Guttural, possessed by Kerri's furious spirit

OskarDispeledEvil_31.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_31.context: NodeContext: Hoarse, throat damaged from screaming while possessed

OskarDispeledEvil_21.speaker: Lady Jannath
OskarDispeledEvil_21.text: No, not Kerri. It's me, Fireliia. Your wife.
OskarDispeledEvil_21.context: NodeContext: Soothing, thinks he's mistaken her for someone else

OskarDispeledEvil_18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_18.text: Fireliia? ...Please... I don't have much time...
OskarDispeledEvil_18.context: NodeContext: Words laboured, like he hasn't had control of his own tongue for a while

OskarDispeledEvil_19.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_19.text: I found the hidden portrait in your atelier.

OskarDispeledEvil_2.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_2.text: He said never... never to finish.

OskarDispeledEvil_24.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_24.text: But she cried out... and the paint... it wanted to be used.
OskarDispeledEvil_24.context: NodeContext: Feverish, struggling to stay conscious

OskarDispeledEvil_27.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_27.text: Do you know what's wrong with you?

OskarDispeledEvil_5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_5.text: No... I was painting, painting her portrait...
OskarDispeledEvil_5.context: NodeContext: Words laboured, like he hasn't had control of his own tongue for a while

OskarDispeledEvil_7.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_7.text: He helped me... gave me the paint...
OskarDispeledEvil_7.context: NodeContext: Feverish, struggling to stay conscious

OskarDispeledEvil_16.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_16.context: NodeContext: Loses consciousness at the end of the line

OskarDispeledEvil_6.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_6.text: She watches, in my atelier... She has come back...
OskarDispeledEvil_6.context: NodeContext: Loses consciousness at the end of the line

OskarDispeledEvil_0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_0.text: Paint... to capture her beauty... in the atelier...
OskarDispeledEvil_0.context: NodeContext: Loses consciousness at the end of the line

OskarDispeledEvil_20.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_20.text: Whatever evil had you in its grip - it's gone now.

OskarDispeledEvil_25.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_25.text: No... no... it is still here. She is still here...

OskarDispeledEvil_10.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_10.text: She wants me back... She is coming for me...
OskarDispeledEvil_10.context: NodeContext: Feverish, struggling to stay conscious

OskarDispeledEvil_15.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_15.text: Is there anything that could help free you?

OskarDispeledEvil_12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_12.text: Carrion... His invitation, in the atelier...
OskarDispeledEvil_12.context: NodeContext: Loses consciousness at the end of the line

OskarDispeledEvil_11.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_11.text: Why is she coming for you?

OskarDispeledEvil_26.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_26.text: I was painting her... in the atelier... He said it would work...
OskarDispeledEvil_26.context: NodeContext: Loses consciousness at the end of the line

OskarDispeledEvil_17.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_17.text: I can end this mercifully, if you prefer.

OskarDispeledEvil_29.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_29.text: Not yet... Find his invitation... in the atelier...
OskarDispeledEvil_29.context: NodeContext: Loses consciousness at the end of the line

OskarDispeledEvil_3.speaker: Player
OskarDispeledEvil_3.text: Peace, Oskar. I will find a more permanent cure.

OskarDispeledEvil_23.speaker: Oskar Fevras
OskarDispeledEvil_23.text: You can't... She will come for me again...

TraspassCrime_0.speaker: Tarhun Mnemonis
TraspassCrime_0.text: |You are traspassing in Lady Jannath's estate!|

AD_KerriComment_Turn2_0.text: I can't live without you, Oskar. Is that what you want to hear?
